intro: Banisteriopsis schizoptera, commonly known as the sacred tree or copal tree, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces a unique type of fruit known as a schizocarp, which splits into segments when mature. It is also valued for its medicinal properties, with traditional uses in treating various ailments. Its ecological importance is significant, as it provides habitat and food for numerous rainforest species.
